chargeHist.descr: Purchase Pseudoephedrine for Another with Intent/Facilitate Another Person's Manufacture of Meth

result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all financial obligations in 15CF96 and successful discharge from probation
AODA assessment/compliance
Absolute sobriety--no alcohol/no taverns/no illegal drugs
$150 fee to Criminal Diversion Program
State shall have 60 days after termination to file motion revoking Agreement
Refrain from conduct which constitutes a violation of the criminal laws of any state of the United States or ordinances substantially conforming to a criminal statute.
Bond continued as amended

Court questions Defendant on employment. Sowinski moves to dismiss 15CF11. Burns does not object. Court grants dismissal. adj 02:12 PM  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 14, 2019 at 02:30 pm.

11:12 a.m. Defendant Jute T. Handrick in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Mary M Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 18cf158, 17cm419, 16cm384, 15cf11. Burns will be appointed - requests adjournment to review cases. In 18cf158 - In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived. Bail continued. Adj. 11:21 a.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 16, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

1:22 p.m. Defendant Jute T. Handrick, in custody, in court with attorney Chad Lynch. Michael William Schiek, DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling  15CF11, 16CM384, 17CM419. Asst. Corp. Counsel Mike Fugle also appears for 11PA18PJ. Calling 15CF11 - motion to rescind/court quashes warrants on all cases. Lynch statement; advises court that Handrick has set up/completed assessment. Court speaks to 11PA18PJ - Handrick states he's been struggling with transportation; therefore nonappearance. Fugle statement--few payments made; to pay $389/mo.; speaks to arrears/interest. Handrick working for painter--cash money. Court statement. Fugle requests adj.- 6/21/18 at 9:00 a.m. for RH - Signature bond reinstated in 15CF11. Motion hearing/status conference scheduled for July 17, 2018 at 11:00 am. for criminal matters.

2:33 p.m. Attorney Chad Lynch in court. Defendant does not appear. Michael William Schiek, DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin on behalf of ADA Sowinski. Calling 15CF11, 16CM384, 17CM419. Lynch statement--received call from defendant indicating he was planning to appear, but ride fell through; has warrant in family case. Lynch spoke previously with ADA Sowinski; Lynch requests adjournment to give defendant opportunity to obtain his own ride to court. Schiek requests warrant. Court authorizes warrant. 2:37 p.m.

3:40 p.m. Defendant Jute T. Handrick in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Mary M Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 17cm419, 16cm384, 15cf11. Court speaks to records in all matters - 15cf11 - Motion to Rescind Deferred Agreement; 16cm384 - review of court costs; 17cm419 - status. Lynch statement-crisis screening was done - inpatient 3 days - Human Service Center scheduled appointment for 4/6/18. Defendant is scheduled for outpatient treatment - beds are still available at Koinonia - still waiting for assessment from Human Service Center. Defendant confirms mailing address. Physical address of grandmother 422 Oneida St., Minocqua, WI. Defendant is staying with grandmother. Sowinski statement. Court modifies bond - Must follow through with mental health and AODA counseling at Marshfield Clinic. Must provide documentation of attendance at counseling at next court hearing. Must keep scheduled appointment with Human Services - Defendant must make all reasonable efforts to obtain in-patient treatment at Koinonia. Defendant statement to outpatient treatment at Marshfield Clinic. No intoxicants; no taverns and no contact provisions to remain. Court statement to defendant. Bail continued. Adj. 3:56 p.m.  Status conference scheduled for May 24, 2018 at 02:30 pm.

2:05 Defendant Jute T. Handrick in court via video with attorney Chad Lynch.  Defendant Jute T. Handrick in custody.  Mary M Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Calling 16cm384,(RH) 17cm419 and 15cf11(MH) 
Court statement to status of cases -Lynch statement regarding treatment for Defendant- requesting sig bond in 17cm419  - Chad will personally bring him from jail to Koinonia- Sowinski statement - Court statement -  modifies 17cm419 bond to sig bond - same conditions - Court statement to Defendant.  Sowinski request short time for adj to see how defendant is doing in treatment.  ADA Sowinski may appear telephonicaly
  Status conference scheduled for March 9, 2018 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Jute T. Handrick in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Mary M Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jute T. Handrick in court with attorney Chad Lynch. to Rescind

3:15 Defendant Jute T. Handrick in court, via video  in custody.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pfeifer statement to status of DPA- Request motion date and will file motion to rescind
Bail continued  Motion hearing scheduled for October 5, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement
No contact with Andi Hansen lifted/stricken

Defendant Jute T. Handrick in court with attorney Daniel Francis Snyder.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also calling 15CF96. Plea questionnaire and waiver filed. State moves to amend Ct. 1 to msd. bail jumping, s. 946.49(1)(a), in 15CF96. Granted by the court. Defendant pleads no contest. State moves to dismiss but read in Ct. 2 in 15CF11. Granted by the court. Defendant pleads no contest.  Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1 in 15CF96 as amended. 

Court finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1 in 15CF11 but defers entry. Deferred Entry of Judgment filed/accepted by the Court. Snyder statement to bond conditions--requests no contact provision be lifted. No objection by the State. Court grants motion to amend bond; no contact provision stricken with regards to Andi Hansen only. The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4). Bond continued as amended by the Court.

Court sentence - 15CF96
WHS
1 yr. POP 
CC/CV/Supervision
Follow conditions in Deferred Entry Agreement in 15CF11
DNA Surcharge
DNA sample
Appeal rights given
